column1: Translations from the Elvish was a work
column2: written in three volumes by Bilbo Baggins between  and
column3: during his stay in Rivendell. They formed a substantial part of the Red Book of Westmarch
column4: but were omitted from other versions. They were preserved only in the Thains Book and its copies.

column1: Obviously it included such works as the Ainulindalë (song) and the Valaquenta.
Category:Books and documents within the legendarium
